body_html:
I've adjusted the existing test for Sum and added tests for the other three reducers.

One thing I've noticed is that all of the python tests make use of test_session(use_gpu=True) instead of force_gpu=True (With the exception of one function in scatter_ops_test.py).
When an op isn't defined for the GPU, this will happily run it on the CPU, kind of bypassing the original intent of the test.
But changing use_gpu to force_gpu everywhere would probably require a lot of cleanup work to make the tests pass again.

What's your opinion on switching to force_gpu to make the tests more strict?

I've adjusted the existing test for `Sum` and added tests for the other three reducers.

One thing I've noticed is that all of the python tests make use of `test_session(use_gpu=True)` instead of `force_gpu=True` (With the exception of one function in `scatter_ops_test.py`).
When an op isn't defined for the GPU, this will happily run it on the CPU, kind of bypassing the original intent of the test.
But changing `use_gpu` to `force_gpu` everywhere would probably require a lot of cleanup work to make the tests pass again.

What's your opinion on switching to `force_gpu` to make the tests more strict?
